definition: to hum and haw (idiom); to mumble as if hiding sth/to speak and break off, then start again/to hold sth back
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)

sentences.english: He hesitated and added, the muscles of his face contracting whitely.
sentences.chinese: 他一臉的肌肉在皺縮發白，一面吞吞吐吐地接下去說。
他的聲音猶豫不決，吞吞吐吐。

sentences.english: What agony was this! And the man seemed resolved to protract it.
sentences.chinese: 那是什麼病痛呀？這人似乎決意吞吞吐吐。

sentences.english: He began to hem when talking about where he was that night.
sentences.chinese: 一談到那天夜裏他在哪兒，他就開始吞吞吐吐起來。

sentences.english: And the man seemed resolved to protract it.
sentences.chinese: 這人似乎決意吞吞吐吐。

sentences.english: Call him, he said, speak hesitatingly or continue to make friends.
sentences.chinese: 給他打電話，他吞吞吐吐說不合適，還是繼續做朋友。

sentences.english: Think good words to the mouth side, speak hesitatingly again.
sentences.chinese: 想好的話到嘴邊處，又吞吞吐吐。

sentences.english: She began to question her daughter, but has been hesitant Xiaoqing, talk is not clear.
sentences.chinese: 她開始質問女兒，可是小青一直吞吞吐吐，講不清楚。

sentences.english: The deputy chairman hem med and hawed without giving a definite answer.
sentences.chinese: 副主席說話吞吞吐吐，沒有給個明確的答覆。

definition: to hem and haw/to stall/to stammer/to mumble/to falter
to respond evasively or vaguely/to elude/to stall
to want to say sth but then hesitate
to show signs of reluctance or embarrassment
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
